TextView.android:text: I am now going to ask you some questions about your baby’s stay in the hospital.
Section III: Treatment of Neonatal Infection
Was your baby admitted to neonatal care unit/paediatric ward for a problem?
Do you know your baby’s problem?
a) What is your baby’s problem?
Specify
b) If you were you told your baby had an infection, what type of infection did they have?
Do you know your baby’s weight at time of admission to this unit?
a. How much did your baby weigh? (grams)
Don’t know/don’t remember
Did your baby have any seizures during the hospital stay?
04a. How many days did your baby have the seizure/s?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Do you know if your baby received any injection/antibiotics?
05a. If YES, what are the antibiotics?
Specify 1
Specify 2
Specify 3
Don’t know/don’t remember
b. How many days in total did your baby receive injection antibiotics?
Do you have any antibiotics to give your baby when you go home?
Did your baby receive oxygen during hospital stay ? PROMPT SHOW PICTURE IF NECESSARY
Were diagnostic tests completed with your baby?
08a. What tests were completed? MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS
1) Lumbar puncture
2) Blood tests
3) Blood sugar using a finger prick and strip of paper
4) Other
Specify
5) Don’t know/don’t remember

Did your baby receive any feeding support, such as through a tube in his/her nose or injection line in his/her hand/arm/foot/scalp or a cup? PROMPT: USE VISUAL AIDES. MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS
a) Yes, NG feed
b) Yes, IV
c) Yes, cup feeding
d) No
e) Don’t know/don’t remember
Did your baby receive any phototherapy during the hospital stay? For example, was your baby yellow and put underneath lights?
How many nights has your baby been admitted in inpatient care?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Did the health worker refer your baby to another place or health facility?
Do you know your baby’s weight at time of discharge to this unit?
a) How much did your baby weigh? (grams)
Don’t know/don’t remember
INTERVIEWER COMMENTS
